comment: He is okay. He's very political, only grades based on a few things: quizzes, two main tests, and two main essays. If you fail one of his weekly quizzes (which only has one question), it would mess up your grade really badly. I would take him if you like sociology, he seems to love teaching.

Only 4 tests so don't mess up. Really enthusiastic guy and you can tell he loves what he teaches. Not mandatory to attend but a lot of what he says on his lectures is in the tests. Only reason I got a B was because I messed up on one test. Tests are online no lockdown browser! Great professor would take him again.

Choose him! Only 4 Test whole unit. Only lockdown browsers no camera. So use notes and phone. Go get your attendance and use the class time to do other work or study! He's chill it's a big class so he really teaches and lets you be. If you want to pay attention you can but everything is posted online. He's also someone who's enthusiastic about soci

I really enjoyed his class! his lectures were interesting and i liked how in class he'd play some jazz before we got started. he was a really nice guy! the exams are easy, lockdown browser but no webcam. no hw and you can do the quizzes as practice they don't count towards your grade
VERYY VERY EASY!! Love him! And if you go his lectures they're actually engaging
he is the best! PLEASE take him. so caring and kind. Your grade is made up of 4 exams that are open note. super easy A. lectures are entertaining and I love hearing what he has to say.

Hutchinson made learning sociology very easy and interesting. He provides everything you need to get an A on every test (4 total, no final). Video lectures, practice quizzes, and PowerPoint notes are all available. An amazing intro to sociology.

Professor Hutchinson's class is a straightforward A with minimal effort. Attend lectures to get the fill-in-the-blank notes, and use Unstuckstudy to prepare for the open-book exams. Easy A, low difficulty.

Very straightforward class. 4 multiple choice exams. He gives quizzes that aren't graded but I highly recommend taking them as many test questions are straight from the quiz. Weekly lectures I found entertaining and aligned with the exams. I would watch the lecture videos right before the exams and take notes and passed with an A. TAKE HIM

Loved this class, kind of sad I didn't have him in person. Each week he'd post the new module with a video of him talking through the lecture, but also just posted the powerpoint so you don't HAVE to watch it. Only grades are the 4 exams on lockdown but they are open note and pretty straightforward. Take him for an easy A, he's a great professor!

great professor very passionate about what he teaches. test are super easy because he provides practice quizzes that are very similar material. there is only 4 test total that determine your grade, but all the test are online no camera so open notes.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This was a great introduction to Sociology. You can tell Professor Hutchinson is passionate about his field. The PowerPoints & lectures contain all the information you need. He clears his throat a lot- so lectures may be difficult if you have sensory issues. Otherwise, take him. You won't regret it.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly really enjoyed his approach in class. He was pretty chill and only graded based off of exams that he gave all the answers in class to. Definitely a bit biased on certain topics and some questions on the exams were simply his opinion on things. I went to his class because he knows his stuff and was pretty funny. Attendance is not graded

Had weekly lectures that were sometimes too long. Only had 4 tests and no assignments. Very heavy on taking notes from the lectures. You will spend a lot of time for this class even if it is online. Besides all of that, good professor and responds quickly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: His lectures were extremely long and he often went on tangents that I thought were funny. He explained everything in great detail and would state in his lectures the information that would be included on the test. No other assignments were given; it was just lectures every week until the unit test. I would recommend an easy A.

Very boring lectures; I won't lie, they're definitely tough to sit through. Unfortunately, pretty much all of the information for the exams can only be found in the lectures. Hutchinson is very polite and cooperate though, so if you can stomach the 90min long class, I think it was a pretty easy A. Just don't take it at 9am like I did.

This class was great. There are no assignments, only four exams with lockdown browser no webcam. If you watch the lecture and take notes the exams will be very easy. There are multiple quizzes, but they are optional and not for a grade. Overall, the class was great, I would take him again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Understand that Mr. Hutchinson's class is NOT an easy A. It is an easy B. 4 exams lockdown browser is all you get to try and secure above a 90 average on them which is not easy. You can skip the lectures and get a B, but if you are someone who cares about an A you must attend and go hard on the exams because you will have nothing else for your avg

4 tests and he gives some of the questions in a practice quiz before hand. He creates the other questions and they are actually difficult. Cool guy, but just very annoying and has a voice that gets annoying. Come to class to get the fill in the blank notes, I guess they help you a little bit on the test. Tests are lockdown no browser too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Attendance not mandatory and can easily get an A w/o going to class. Exams are online open for a week. He posts "holey" slides to incentivize going to class, but using the book and common sense (or the people who do go to class), they're easy to fill in.
This class was a breeze. No assignments only 4 easy exams with lockdown browser.

Professor Hutchinson is a very nice man, he's a little kooky but, a relatively understanding professor. We have 3 MCQ Tests, 3 Essays, and 12 weekly reflection responses in class. You *can* pass by not going but I would recommend going anyways, his MCQ Exams are a bit lecture heavy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Hutchinson's online sociology class was a good, easy class. Lectures for each topic are clear. There wasn't any homework. Multiple quizzes for each module, but they are optional and not for a grade. Tests are similar to lectures and not too hard. No cumulative final, just a final test. Would take his class again.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I loved his class, especially because he is so passionate about his class so it made me pay attention. I did take it as an 8 am so sometimes it was hard to get there (I don't recommend 8 am classes) he only has 4 tests, and you need your notes. He does fill in the black so if you're not in class youll basically miss out on the answers for the test
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class is based on four exams and that's it. It's easy to pass as long as you show up or get the notes. He requires lock down browser but no cameras, so the tests are completely open note. Lectures are long and boring but very straightforward. Not a hard class as long as you don't take it in the A.M (like i did)

Professor Hutchinson had simple instructions. Read the powerpoints/watch his lectures and that is it. There are 4 tests that make your grade- I had a B average and he bumped me all the way to an A without any extra credit. Tests are lockdown no webcam.

He is a very nice guy who is truly passionate about sociology. You are only graded on 4 exams all of which are open note and are based on the lectures. He uploads the powerpoints but certain parts are missing so it's best to go to class to get the notes.

He asks you to get the textbook but as long as you go to class and take the notes you don't need it. He leaves holes in the lectures on D2L but u can always just ask someone for it if u miss class. He's really nice and energetic at 8am. You're graded on 4 open notes tests
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Hutchinson is my favorite professor at KSU. I have taken multiple of his classes and have enjoyed all of them. He rarely uses powerpoints for lectures, which I personally enjoy. You can tell he is very passionate about the topics he teaches. He is very approachable and easy to talk to. I definitely recommend taking one of his classes.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: As a psych major I thought this course would be very interesting. I was wrong, I was VERY bored with this course. Professor Hutchison is passionate about what he teaches but he does not know how to make it interesting to the students. Also, your grade is based off of 4 exams including the final, there are no extra credit options, so good luck !

Very few assignments in the course so if you mess up a few you're at risk for failing. He's a very strict grader and does not give great feedback. If you make simple mistakes he treats you with a very condescending and stuck up demeanor. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is, pure and simple, not a good teacher. There were only 4 exams over the entire course; they were largely from his lectures but the instructions were fairly unclear. I only realized very late into the course that we were allowed to use notes. He is awful at online course tools as well, and everything was badly organized.

He's an extremely harsh grader, you have to write your discussion posts and essay exams based off his voiceover lectures, more than the textbook. If you can take someone else do so. It's just a sociology class, he is doing way too much. 4 discussion posts, 2 essay exams, 2 multiple choice exams that are ten questions.
Good teacher, lots of tests. Basically you'll only be graded for tests, otherwise no homework.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Loved his class. He was a sweet and pretty funny old man who was very passionate about what he taught. Throughout the course we only took 4 exams all of which were online on lockdown browser (but no camera required.) Super easy class, just make sure to take notes and you'll pass.
never take him EVER!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Lecture heavy (goes off topic a lot) but everything he says is on our essays/exams. He allows open notes & on the essay exams you can only use your notes from the lecture, not google etc. The 1st paper is 8 pg, 2nd paper 10-13 pgs, our final paper 8-10 pgs. Only 6 grades in the grade book. Overall he is a professor who loves to teach
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Hutchinson is the worst professor I have ever taken. His class is completely based off his own knowledge and the book, somewhat. He doesn't care for his students, he is simply there to get paid. He doesn't use power points, he is old school and lectures by writing on the whiteboard. DO NOT TAKE.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I liked this class. Final grade relies on 4 test throughout the semester that are open note, internet is blocked during the test. Take notes during the lecture, answers to test questions can be found straight from there! He requires a textbook, I never used it only my notes. Attendance is taken but not required. Very easy to pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Every class is a lecture by PowerPoint. He covers a lot of information but there are only 4 grades, which are 50 questions exams. The exams are online with lockdown browser only blocking internet, he gives you about a week to complete. Attendance is taken but not graded, show up for notes. I bought the textbook required didnt use it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I didnt care for a lot of stuff he said cause most of it was his own opinions, which werent on the test. Definitely get the textbook, the exams are open note and it helps when writing essays. He includes review sheets online for each exam so just fill that out from the book, or just use the book to take tests.

I absolutely loved professor Hutchinson! I did not agree with some of the things he lectured on but he is by far one of the best professors I have had. He only has 4 tests that make up your final grade so go to class and listen and you will do great. Such a kind-hearted funny man.

I skipped a lot, but went in person to take tests and hand in papers. He never did power points. He was always going off topic or sharing his own opinion, which weren't gonna be on tests. His tests are really easy though, it's open book/note, so having the textbook is really helpful for that as well as the essay exams to complete before test dates.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: He is a cool and funny guy but there are only FOUR grades within the whole semester. DO NOT take him if you are not a good test taker. You have to go to class to get the blanks within the notes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: All about how you do on the exams. They were all pretty easy. He tries to keep the lectures interesting in class too. Overall, good experience.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He was really funny and put in effort to keep the class entertained! There are 4 exams that make up your grade, 100% multiple choice, come straight from the lectures, and a lot of the questions have common sense answers. An easy A, all you have to do is show up and take some notes really. I definitely recommend  taking his class!

His lectures are a lot of fun and he is very passionate about teaching. I loved his class and working with others in my class. The class is easy as long as you show up, pay attention, and collaborate/study with your classmates. I would take him again if I could. I definitely recommend him for anyone taking Intro to Sociology.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: he teachers all over the place and goes off topic he doesnt use any powerpoints writes poor notes on the board all his test are essay only no multiple choice questions if you dont come to class you probably wont pass hes a very old school professor makes learning incredibly boring do yourself a favor and take someone else
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: There arent many grades in this class, and two big grades (the essays) do not have a clear grading criteria. He goes strictly based off of the textbook, no outside sources. Used voiceover lectures from about 5 years ago, and did not engage with the class at all. Took forever to grade papers. Not the worst professor, but dont recommend at all.

his tests are directly from the textbook his lectures. He does not allow outside sources because of the fact that all the material can be found in the lectures. Make sure you are copying everything word for word and you'll do great. I wish all my professors were like him.

Took the online class. Your grade is based on 4 100pt tests. At the start of each unit,he gave us a study guide to refer to as we listened to his lectures and looked at his slides. He also had practice quizzes that you could take to prepare for tests. Most of the quiz questions were on the test! If you fail this class,it's because YOU wanted to!

Please do not take this class... He ghosted my entire class for almost two weeks and all he did apologize (No explanation) and make us go back and do assignments that he never posted. Lectures are good-ish but he's very opinionated so I felt that I was writing more what he believed versus my opinion.

He is sweet and so knowledgeable but he grades very harshly. He also provides little to no feedback on huge exams. He will mention you missed something in the second question, but doesnt tell you what so you have zero way of learning from any mistake you make. he also takes forever to trade so you barely know your grade all semester

Professor Hutchinson is a nice guy and is very knowledgeable. However, you are only graded on 4 discussion posts & 4 exams, two of which are only 10 question MC & the other two are essay questions (3 questions that require 2 pages each) it is very tricky to do well in his class. He also takes like the whole semester to get grades back.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This teacher is not the worse but definitely close. He does his online sociology 1101 class as a 400 point system with just 4 tests each counting 100 points. This idea is insane because any college student knows that just being graded on their test grades is screwed up because it's close to impossible. His tests are inconsistent and vary
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Never answers emails and grades everything 2 days before grades are due. You have no idea what grade you have in the class the entire time. Do NOT take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Very slow grading homework

his class consists of 4 unit tests. He was honestly very educated and pretty funny. the key to passing this class is to take very good notes and to read the questions carefully. I am a horrible test taker and his tests were manageable because they were open note. He includes 4 practice quizzes which give 15-20 tests questions. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If sociology isnt an interesting subject to you and you just need it for a pre-req, then dont take Prof. Richardson. He knows what hes talking about but goes off on long rants. Grades only consists of 4 tests, and theyre online, but he doesnt do a good job at teaching the material needed for the test.

This professor grades harshly and is slow in getting results back to you timely. The lectures were interesting & understandable but his paper assignments are where the grades count & its hard to please him. He is not clear when delivering an assignment. He expects you to know exactly what he wants but he doesn't give good instructions. Stay Away!

Dr. Hutchinson is one of my favorite professors. I only took Sociology for a social science credit, but now I've signed up for Foundations of Social Theory with him. He's funny and genuinely cares about the topics he teaches. He's also very opinionated, so don't take him if you're really close-minded. Overall a great professor :)
rants about topics that does not even correspond with sociology. VERY BORING. lecture heavy and only grades you on just four exams. So if you fail one exam you are basically screwed !
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take his class for upper level credits . He gives few assignments that have a lot of weight. The due dates are mixed up, syllabus not clear, too many writing assignments, not a quick turnaround on grading, and no extra credit. Unnecessarily difficult!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I see that people who had him for sociology 1101 had an easy experience. Well, do not take him for any upper level classes. He grades unfairly, is totally unclear on expectations, is boring, rude, and unreasonable. He is uninterested in being helpful or constructive by far the WORST experience I have ever had with a teacher. Dont take his class

Literally the easiest A I have ever gotten. Tests are open note and open book. do not by the book total waste of money. I feel like I learned nothing though. Pretty much just talked about politics and went on rants. But easy A and it was gen ed so who cares.
Awesome.
Easy A. Online tests, no lockdown. Open note, so make sure you take notes in class. DONT BUY TEXTBOOK i regret that. Take him for sure if you want an A.

This class was so easy. Attendance not mandatory and power points posted online. I only went to class for maybe the first week and then never went again and I got an A. 4 Tests all online and not proctored. I would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: SOC3354 4 essays, Don't bother trying to please him. He gives a title on the papers but then takes points off for things he "expects" to see but doesn't tell you to put into it. Forget theology, what is this Sociology or something? He wants to see statistics. Online course, didn't get papers back with feedback until months later. mean to boot

Hes a hardcore democrat. But hes pretty funny and gives great lectures which you HAVE TO TAKE NOTES ON. I only missed one class and did pretty well, but one guy only made it to a class or two and he got an A so it doesnt matter if you go or not, but you have to have good notes handy to pass.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is a funny professor, he really cares about his students learning the material. He does not teach off of power points, he does not post any notes and you have to take your own. Listen in class and write down what he says because you can use notes on the tests and the papers. He sometimes teaches things that aren't in the book.

(1101) Lectures are boring, and you will contemplate every class whether or not you will show up. But you do need decent notes to make sure you do good on the tests, which are open note, notes were not posted online for our class. There are practice quizzes that will help on the test too. Prof teaches his own opinion too, which can get annoying.
He was okay... there were only 4 tests, all online, tests came from the notes that were also posted online. It's definitely an 1101 class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easiest A. Never went to class, tests were online, and no textbook or essays. SUPER EASY. Take him.
Dr. Hutchinson was great. 4 tests, all online. All classes were lectures with attendance being optional, all posted on D2L. Lectures can be boring and he is very liberal, but overall, class was easy.

Mr. Hutchinson is one of my favorite professors! He has 3 tests that are open book/note, and for each one there is an essay portion. His lectures are engaging and he has a hilarious sense of humor. He's a wonderful professor and as long as you're good at writing essays and taking notes you'll pass this class no doubt.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is super easy! Never went to class and passed all of tests with A's from the notes online. All of his tests are online including the final. You don't need the book.

If you are looking for an easy A, take him. If you are actually wanting to learn about sociology, take someone else. His lectures are very repetitive and boring, so its good that attendance isn't mandatory. All his tests are online and he puts up practice quizzes with some of the questions that show up on the test. It would be very hard to fail.

Rambles alot. barely paid attention. If you can do a shared google doc and take notes together so you guys can catch information not on the powerpoint. tests are online and he has practice questions that has questions that show up on the actual test.

Hutchinson is passionate about this class and his lectures are really long. He puts his powerpoints online and tests are online. You dont have to show up to class to do well on the tests. If you go over powerpoints, skim over chapters in the book, do practice quizzes (not a grade), and look over his review sheet you should get an A on each test.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Don't have to show up to class, but tests are exactly from the lecture. Tests were online, so if you showed up, you're guaranteed an A in this course. Having online tests made it more relaxed so you don't have to memorize any information.

This class was super easy. All you need to do is show up and take detailed notes. The tests are all online. You don't even have to buy the book. He doesn't have a cumulative final, and the last test is online like the other 3. If you want an easy A with no homework (not including the 4 online tests), take this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Hutchinson's class was very easy. There's four tests but are all online. The only grades are the tests. You don't need to buy the book.

Easy to get someone else to sign you in, all powerpoints are posted on D2L, very easy A, lectures are lengthy and he lectures from start to finish, all exams taken online outside of class so take good notes and get help and they are an easy A.

One of the best teachers I've had! His tests are very easy if you attend his lectures and read his powerpoints! You can get an A even if you don't attend class because he uploads all his powerpoints online. His tests are very straightforward. Only grades in class are 3 tests and a final.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: 4 test grades make up your entire grade in this course. Lectures are somewhat boring, but the professor tries to make them humorous. Easy class overall, don't bother with buying the book- you don't ever use it. Gives practice quizzes and you have a week to find the time to take the exams. Overall a good choice for an easy course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Out of classroom tests online

The quizzes were ridiculously hard & I've made better grades in my 3000/4000 level classes. It was a new course one his colleagues made aka a complete disaster. No type of instruction & onlycommunication was a condescending paragraph about how we interpreted something wrong. it had to be curved due to what a complete and utter disastrous it was.

Hutchinson is the most humorous teacher I've had by far! I took him for intro to Sociology, Social theory and Criminology. For Criminology you need the book (he lets you use it for tests) he also lets you use your notes. SHOW UP TO CLASS!! Easy A if you take notes.  Very liberal.

LOL this man is a total Jerk and does not help students that are working and going to school at the same time. He consistently graded things late, and NEVER followed the same rubric for the WEEKLY discussion posts. Super awkward deadlines for assignments. 10/10 would recommend not taking him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: TAKE HIM. Even though he's extremely liberal in his views, Dr. Hutchinson was an amazing and hilarious professor. You MUST show up to class because he only lectures and writes on the board. TESTS ARE SUPER EASY if you do the quizzes and write down what he writes down. 3 tests and that's it. Lowest grade I made was a 91.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you don't have the book you'll fail. I had the book and it was still impossible.

There are 3 tests. show up to class. but before each test he puts quizzes (not for a grade) online, overall about 20-25 questions and if you do them and memorize them, those exact questions are on the test so you're guaranteed at least a 50. He also gives a study guide at the beginning of every unit and everything on there is on the test. great
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly, if you show up to class, you should not have a problem passing the class. I found Dr. Hutchinson's lectures thoroughly entertaining and he incorporates humor to keep you engaged. Your grade is based purely on 3 tests, but he posts ungraded quizzes on D2L with identical questions to the ones found on the test along with review sheets.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Hutchinson is so energetic and makes class very relatable in real world events. I had him for an 8 am and was never put to sleep. He puts practice quizzes online (don't count against your grade) with exact questions from the tests. Write down everything he writes on the board and you'll pass. COME TO CLASS. LECTURE BASED TEST. don't buy book

Awesome! Quite passionate about subject. Lectures are very interesting and inspirational. If you aren't open minded, do not take. He can be opinionated sometimes. I found myself enjoying Sociology more than I anticipated. Attendance is not a requirement. Though, find a friend to exchange notes with in the event you can't make it for lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof Hutchinson is an awesome and funny professor. He made having sociology as an 8 AM a lot less painful. This class isn't hard at all and although he takes attendance, it doesn't count towards your grade so honestly doesn't matter whether you come or not. He always posts review sheets and practice quizzes on D2L which ARE A LOT LIKE his exams!!

Took him online and no matter how much work I put into this class it was never good enough for him. I am A/B average student and this man made me feel like a failing student. Grades papers really hard. Quiz consist of one question so you either get a 100 or a 0. He expects you to be a expert like him in subject. I ended up with a C.
You have to go to every class and they are all super boring and painful to listen to. He does not write anything on the board or powerpoint. Only talks to you in a monotone voice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's definitely a weird guy, but I'd totally take him again. Honestly, I found his class and teaching method annoying at the time but now that I'm in higher level classes I'm really glad I took his course. I learned a lot and the way he teaches really committed it to my memory. 3 papers and 3 tests which are open book/note/paper. Great class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Open book tests, show up and pay attention easy pass

Incredibly easy class, half of the questions on his tests come from the online quizzes and the other half are simple questions straight from his lectures. If you are republican do not take him, he is VERY liberal and many of his lectures are heavily opinionated.

If you are a good listener then super easy class. His tests are straight from his lectures and there are only three tests. He also gives quizzes online-not for a grade, and those questions are on the test. He is hard to listen to though and has terrible handwriting.

Dr. Hutchinson is my favorite professor at KSU! I've had him as my professor at least three times and always look for him first when registering. He's extremely passionate about what he teaches and manages to make even the most boring topics interesting. As long as you come to class and take decent notes, you'll be just fine.

Would take again. Lectures could be so boring, but worth going. Tests are based straight from the lectures. Only grades are 3 tests. He provides study guides and study quizzes that have questions straight from the tests. Go to class and take notes, do the study guide and quizzes, and you'll make an A.

Just took him for SOCI1101 and there were only 3 tests. I'm not the best test taker but I do okay. On here it says he gives out quizzes, which he does not. I made an 86, 82, & failed my final exam with a 68. Ended up with a 79 in the class and I begged him to bump my grade up to a B and no matter what I said he would not change it.
Taken him multiple times, test are open book open note. If you listen in class it's an easy A

Very Hard class. He thinks he is a sociologist theorist himself, expect you to know the theorist's and his theory like the back of your own hand. Tests are not hard but papers are long and hard. He is very political so if you are a republican I suggest you do not take this class because he is anti-trump. his writing is very hard to read. good luck!

This class is extremely boring, but it isn't his fault. The book is SO important so get it! It is hard to understand the material, but he explains it all in class if you listen, but if you don't then you just have to figure it out yourself when you write your papers. Two take home essays that have to be 8 pages and 12 page paper due at end of term

Gosh! He is alright. He is very tough and very picky. Grade consists of three essay exams and four multiple choice exams. The exams are not a walk in the park; this is also true for the essay exams. He lectures from beginning to the end of class so be prepared for that. I would choose another professor for criminology. Easy AB course. Got a 91.8%.

Love Hutchinson. This is my second course with him. Tests are open note, open book and consist of half multiple choice, half take home essay. GET THE BOOK. He does lecture straight from the book, and tests are based off book info. 4 tests and an article summary. Super easy professor.
Wonderful professor. Would take again and again. He challenges you, but he really wants you to succeed. Open note exams and papers.

The test only covers what he talks about inlecture, so if you come to class and pay attention (lecture is pretty interesting so it shouldn't be hard), you'll get an A. He gives study guides and practice quizzes (those questions will be on the exam) for the exams, which are very straightforward multiple-choice. I got a 99 with minimal studying

The professor seems to be somewhat helpful but the essay exams are ridiculous.  5 page paper exams.  In addition to several 5 page paper exams there is a 10 page research project.  I don't mind writing papers but between the exams and research project it is a bit excessive.

Very hard class. If you do not attend class you won't get a good grade. Finished with an 89 after attending every class, completing all assignments, and making A's in every test. It is a lot of work for not a good outcome. Would not take him again.

Dr. Hutchinson's Principles of Sociology class was quite enjoyable. He's very respectful to his students, he has a great sense of humor, and you can tell that he's passionate about the field of sociology. I will say that he drags his lectures out to the very last second, which can be pretty painful at times.

The best online class I have ever taken. He takes the time to ensure that the students are learning what they need to learn, and reinforces it with lectures (which is not usual for online classes)! He is not a hard grader, but wants to make sure you are getting what you need to from a college level class. Definitely worth the extra money and time!
The tests are not hard, however, if you do not pay attention you will struggle with his essays, he is a hard grader when it comes to them.

He's a really nice guy. Vibrant and always has a smile on his face. I had him for social org, it was SO. BORING. Not his fault though. We had two take home essay exams that are 8-10 pages, and one big case study on a corporation that's broken up throughout the semester to two 5 page papers. Really easy grader. Best of a bad class. NEED BOOK

This class was not worth taking.  He is very unclear.  It is impossible to get a good grade.  The Quizzes are one question! The exams are essay and long!  He is an extremely hard grader.  He is very unapproachable.  Expect to spend all your time on this class to get a passing  grade.  I don't think a good grade is possible with this teacher.
Interesting lectures. Practice quiz questions are on the test, so youre guaranteed to get those right. Hes nice, sometimes funny, easy class. I would definitely take him again.

TAKE HUTCHINSON. He is seriously the best. I hate reading and we didn't need the book, so don't bother getting it. The tests only cover lecture material and practice quizzes, so go to class and take the quizzes! Very clear and straightforward about what will be on the tests.

Dr. Hutchinson is a great professor. Class had 4 OPEN BOOK multiple choice tests and 3 take home essays due on day of the test. He is very passionate about the class. He lectures, but is VERY enthusiastic. I loved the class and I'm registered for 2 of his classes next semester. Attendance not mandatory, but somethings on test are from lectures.
Great professor! Makes everything simple and easy to follow. Lectures are interesting and entertaining. Tests come straight from lectures so go to class! Easy A!
Great teacher.  Every class was interesting.  Easy going, comedic as well.  Excellent professor.  Passionate about Sociological Theory.  Highly recommend.

Funny and keeps the class alive! Gives quizzes about the lectures (does not count towards your grade). Your grade is basically three tests! If you can attend class, play attention, and take notes, you will be fine! All the questions from his quizzes he puts the exact same ones on his tests. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN! -K

VERY easy professor if you go to class and take notes. He writes everything on the board, gives a study guide, & practice quizzes (not a grade). You don't use the book at all. I'm making an A currently just by using those 3 things. 3 tests consist of overall grade so it's not any extra work, but you must do well on the tests to make a good grade!

Loved Dr. Hutchinson as a person and teacher. However, class material is extremely hard to understand.The majority of class did poorly on first few papers. This course itself is for "Master Level" students.I will say he should have broken down material more for Class to understand more.
Very awesome class.  Don't miss a day as content from each day will be mentioned on the tests.  Highly recommended.

This class is pretty hard. When you take the weekly quizzes be sure to write down the test questions because they will be on the test. Attendance is mandatory. He lectures for the entire hour and fifteen minutes and is rather boring. Weekly online quizzes are only 5 questions but don't underestimate them. They can be pretty challenging.

Honestly, I had a hard time understanding him and I was not the only one.  I did all my tests and several essays which I got a Grade C.  I went to a presentation of Kennesaw and he gave 10points but did not help.  I regret taking him.  Hard to understand! I will not take him again that is for sure.
Awesome teacher.  Tests and quizzes straight from lectures.  He is a really funny guy and makes the class a breeze.

An entertaining character. Did an excellent job of explaining everything, made confusing material bearable. Three open book/note tests, two papers (5-10 pages) and weekly quizzes. Nothing you can't do if you keep up and take notes in class.
Very easy to understand and is also very helpful. 1 quiz every week,5 questions per quiz on highlights of lecture.
very confusing man , EVERYTHING comes from notes. no book needed . Take good notes & try to understand him. I made a high B ! wished I got an A

He is a very nice teacher who is very interesting in this subject. It's an easy A if you go to class and take notes. There is a quiz at the end of each week which makes it easy to keep your grade up. We never used the book in class and all of the questions on the quizzes and tests were directly from his notes. very good teacher.

He is Awesome, he changed things up this semester and added weekly quizzes to the syllabus, along with the 3 exams. Everything is based on notes/lecture, if you go to class and take notes its an easy A. He is really funny. Attendance is not required but you really should go!
He is very easy and very clear what is going to be on the exams. Come to class, take notes, you don't use the book at all in this class. As long as you come to class and take notes you are set.

I took Hutchinson for Religion in Society. This class was both interesting and easy; we had 3 exams each with a multiple choice section (taken in class) and take-home essay questions. We also had to do a "faith project" which was another easy A. Only downside to this class was the ceaseless discussion of the controversy about the ground zero mosque
hes fantastic ! i didnt know what sociology was when i first signed up for it, but now its my favorite class (:

Had him for basic sociology. He is very interesting to listen to and makes class fun due to how he talks. However his tests were abstract. He gave three tests all semester. NO OTHER GRADES. The tests are completely based on lecture. He hates powerpoint, and makes up his own words. Abstract and tests are the same. A bit confusing. Nice confusing guy

I highly recommend this teacher if you do not mind going to class. His tests come strictly from the notes and are very easy if you took notes. Nothing comes from book. His class was not too boring and he really knows what he is talking about and loves subject. three tests are your grade.

Hutchinson is an awesome professor!!! You do NOT need the book in this class. He is very passionate about the subject and he is funny and interesting! He is so nice and very fair! As long as you go to class and take notes you will pass! GOOD LUCK!
